title: Emile Zola - 11 novels
description:
Ãƒâ€°MILE ZOLA (1840-1902) was a prolific French writer and the most important exemplar of the literary school of naturalism.  He was a major figure in the political liberalization of France and in the exoneration of the falsely accused and convicted army officer Alfred Dreyfus.  He was nominated for the first and second Nobel Prize in Literature in 1901 and 1902.


The following is a small collection of 11 modern translations, a mix of EPUB or PDF formats:

* THE BEAST WITHIN (Penguin Classics, 2007).  Translated by Roger Whitehouse. -- EPUB

* THE BELLY OF PARIS (Modern Library, 2009).  Translated by Mark Kurlansky. -- EPUB

* THE BELLY OF PARIS (Oxford World's Classics, 2007).  Translated by Brian Nelson. -- PDF

* THE DEBACLE (Penguin Classics, 1972).  Translated by Leonard Tancock. -- EPUB

* THE DRINKING DEN (Penguin Classics, 2003).  Translated by Robin Buss. -- EPUB

* THE EARTH [La Terre] (Penguin Classics, 1980).  Translated by Douglas ParmÃƒÂ©e. -- EPUB

* GERMINAL (Penguin Classics, 2004).  Translated by Roger Pearson. -- EPUB

* THE KILL (Modern Library, 2004).  Translated by Arthur Goldhammer. -- EPUB

* THE KILL (Oxford World's Classics, 2004).  Translated by Brian Nelson. -- PDF

* THE LADIES' PARADISE (Oxford World's Classics, 1995).  Translated by Brian Nelson. -- EPUB

* THÃƒâ€°RÃƒË†SE RAQUIN (Penguin Classics, 2004).  Translated by Robin Buss. -- EPUB
